headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Even Tylenol Can’t Cool This AI Fever
summary: Nvidia makes a bullish bet on OpenAI.  The chip giant said it would invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI so that the company can build data centers using Nvidia systems to train and run its next generation of models.  Nvidia's shares rose 4%, adding nearly $170 billion to its market capitalization.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Up As Nvidia Pops; EV Play Skids On Warren Buffett Move (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones index rose on the stock market today amid more Fedspeak. Apple and Tesla popped. Nvidia jumped on a big OpenAI investment.

headline: Chip Equipment Sales Are Booming. These Two Stocks Just Got an Upgrade.
summary: The analysts moved Lam to Equal-weight from Underweight and boosted their price target to $125 from $92.  Shares of Applied Materials were up 4% to $197.84.  The recent turnaround in the memory wafer fab equipment, or WFE, market triggered the revision, Morgan Stanley said.

headline: Why Applied Materials (AMAT) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of semiconductor machinery manufacturer Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) jumped 4.1% in the morning session after Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock's rating to Overweight from Equalweight, citing a bright outlook for the chip equipment market.

headline: ASML Invests 1.3B Euro in Mistral AI: Will it Deliver Growth?
summary: ASML Holding is investing 1.3B Euro in Mistral AI for an 11% stake, aiming to boost lithography tools and long-term chipmaking growth.

headline: Morgan Stanley revisits semicap calls: AMAT, LAM lifted; KLAC downgraded
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley has reshuffled its ratings on U.S. semiconductor capital equipment stocks, revising its industry outlook alongside an upgraded forecast for wafer fab equipment (WFE) spending in 2026.

headline: Full-Color AR Glasses Reach an Inflection Point! JBD Teams Up with Applied Materials and RayNeo to Break Through AR Display Quality Bottlenecks
summary: JBD recently announced that their collaboration with RayNeo and Applied Materials, Inc. has achieved a substantial breakthrough in the display quality of full-color waveguide AR glasses. The results are first commercialized in the RayNeo X3 Pro, markedly elevating the visual performance of consumer-grade waveguide AR glasses.
